newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices rise on credit easing news.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices rise on credit easing news.

text.p: Indian cotton prices rose on Tuesday after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) lifted credit restrictions on the cotton trade, dealers said.
"New crop arrivals were low following unseasonal rains at producing centres but traders were expecting higher arrivals in the next few days if the rains ease," one broker said.
The removal of old credit controls on commodities, including cotton, was among a number of measures announced by the RBI.
In the ready delivery Bengal-deshi rose to 1,000/1,050 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) from 950/1,000 rupees.
